intro: Callianthe tridens, commonly known as the three-toothed sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive three-toothed calyx at the base of its flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments, showcasing its halophytic nature. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and a prominent stamen. Callianthe tridens plays a role in coastal ecosystems by stabilizing sand dunes and providing habitat for small marine organisms.
